place.name: BEARLEY
place.gazetteerText: BEARLEY, a parish in Stratford-on-Avon district, Warwick; on the Stratford branch of the Oxford and Birmingham railway, and near the Birmingham canal, 4 miles NNW of Stratford. It has a station on the railway, and a post office under Stratford-on-Avon. Acres, 810. Real property, £1,348. Pop., 238. Houses, 54. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £62. Patron, King's College, Cam bridge. The church is old. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
